{
  "article_text": [
    "space - charge - limited current ( sclc ) gives the maximum current that can be transported across a solid of length @xmath1 with a biased voltage @xmath2 , limited by the electrostatic repulsion generated by the _ in - transit _ unscreened charge carriers that are in excess of the thermodynamically allowed population @xcite . in a trap - free bulk crystal ,",
    "sclc exhibits a signature current - voltage ( @xmath8-@xmath2 ) characteristics of @xmath9 known as the mott - gurney ( mg ) law @xcite , which is the solid - state counterpart of the sclc in vacuum as given by the child - langumir ( cl ) law : @xmath10 in classical regime @xcite and @xmath11 in quantum regime @xcite . including defect states or traps in solids ,",
    "sclc becomes _ trap - limited _ as described by the mark - helfrich ( mh ) law @xcite : @xmath12 , where @xmath13 , @xmath14 is temperature and @xmath15 is a parameter characterizing the exponential spread in energy of the traps .",
    "due to the geometrical effect @xcite , the 1d sclc value is enhanced as a result of finite emission area @xcite and weakened coulomb screening in high aspect - ratio nanowire @xcite .",
    "furthermore , sclc is an important tool to probe the trap characteristics in solids , and also for photocurrent measurement since the extraction efficiency of photogenerated carriers is fundamentally limited by sclc @xcite .    for organic semiconductors , field - dependent @xcite and density - dependent mobility sclc models @xcite",
    "are commonly employed to characterize the sclc carried by the holes .",
    "similarly , sclc of electrons was found to be universally described by a trap model with gaussian energy distribution in a large class of organic semiconductors @xcite .",
    "recently it is demonstrated that the magnitude of electron sclc can be significantly enhanced via the dilution of traps in conjugated polymer blends of only 10% of active semiconductor @xcite , which opens up an exciting possibility of high - efficiency and low - cost organic light emitting diode .",
    "sclc in the trap - limited regime was re - formulated @xcite with inclusion of the interplay between dopants and traps , poole - frenkel effect @xcite and quantum mechanical tunneling , which has solved the long - standing problem @xcite of the enormously sharp current rise at the trap - limited regime and demonstrated that an exponentially distributed trap is not necessarily required to explain the power - law sharp rises of sclc in the trap - limited regime . remarkably , the model successfully reproduced the anomalous noise - spectrum peak observed in @xcite .    in spite of sclc being a classic model first derived in 1940s ,",
    "it remains an active topic for organic materials and nanowires as mentioned above . with the advances in fabricating novel 2d dirac materials @xcite ,",
    "it is of the interests to revisit the sclc model for these 2d dirac materials . to our best knowledge",
    ", there is no theory or model to deal with the sclc transport in dirac materials .",
    "recent experiments reported a typical @xmath8-@xmath2 characteristic in the form of mh law for highly disordered materials like reduced graphene oxide @xcite . on the other hand , sclc in crystalline monolayer mos@xmath7 @xcite and hbn @xcite",
    "was found to exhibit an unusual power law dependence of @xmath16 with @xmath17 , which was claimed to be originated from the different levels of traps in different samples by using the traditional mh law .",
    "this explanation is doubtful as the traditional mh law is only valid for @xmath18 for @xmath19 , which implies that the voltage scaling from the mh law must be @xmath20 theoretically and it can not be used to fit with the mesured scaling of @xmath17 . for @xmath21 ,",
    "the traps are narrowly distributed in energy space and the sclc essentially reduces to single - level shallow trapping with @xmath22 @xcite .",
    "thus , the observation of @xmath23 can not be explained by the mh law or other sclc models such as shallow trap @xcite , gaussian disorder @xcite , field - dependent @xcite and density - dependent @xcite mobility .    for a dirac material with finite bandgap ,",
    "the electrons mimics relativistic _ massive dirac fermions _",
    "@xcite whereas the classical sclc models are based on the conduction model of _ non - relativistic _ quasi - free electrons @xcite . in this work ,",
    "we proposed a model of _ relativistic _ sclc of massive dirac fermions , which can explain the peculiar @xmath23 scaling observed in recent experiments using dirac materials and thus circumvents the un - justified assumption of @xmath21 used in the mh law in order to fit the experimental data . according to our model",
    ", the @xmath24-@xmath2 characteristics of sclc in a 1d bulk geometry will vary between the non - relativistic limit of @xmath25 to the ultra - relativistic limit of @xmath26 ( this is different from the cl law - see below for explanation ) .",
    "we present a master equation which is in good agreement with the experimental data and can be used to characterize the transition between the ohmic conduction and sclc regime . by extending the bulk 1d model to a 2d thin film model , the scaling relation becomes @xmath0 with @xmath27 varying between 3/2 and 2 , respectively , at the ultra - relativistic and non - relativistic limits . in doing so , we prove rigorously , using a green s function approach@xcite , that the 1d bulk sclc current - voltage scaling relation can be directly mapped to 2d thin - film sclc . it is shown that for a general transport equation of @xmath28 where @xmath29 is a mobility that depends on carrier density , @xmath30 , and @xmath31 is the electric field , the 1d bulk sclc and 2d thin - film sclc are linked by a universal sclc scaling relation ( see section iii ) .",
    "our analysis provides a convenient tool to deduce the 2d thin - film sclc scaling relation via simple 1d sclc model without the need of explicitly solving the complicated 2d sclc model .",
    "in this section , a relativistic sclc model is developed using semiclassical boltzmann transport equation ( bte ) . for simplicity , we first consider the sclc by assuming a simple 1d poisson equation , which allows semi - analytical scaling relations to be determined . in section iii , we shall show that the simple 1d sclc scaling relation derived in this section can be directly mapped to the case of 2d sclc with thin - film geometry .",
    "the starting point of the trap - free sclc theory , i.e. the mott - gurney s law , is the semiclassical bte which provides a basic equation of current density governing the transport of charge carriers .",
    "the diffusion component is usually not considered except in some cases of polymers due to their highly disordered nature . for a quasi - static system , the bte in the linearized transport regime under relaxation - time approximation is @xmath32 where @xmath33 is the electric field , @xmath34 is the crystal momentum , @xmath35 is the position vector , @xmath36 is the carrier velocity , f is the out - of - equilibrium distribution function , @xmath37 is the equilibrium fermi - dirac distribution function , and @xmath38 is a typical collision time scale . if the system is spatially homogeneous the diffusion component of the transport current , i.e. @xmath39 , can be omitted . by assuming a 3d isotropic parabolic energy dispersion , one arrives at the well - known drift - current density , @xmath40 , for semiconductors : @xmath41 by connecting the drift - equation with the 1d poisson equation via charge density @xmath42",
    ", the mott - gurney current - voltage scaling of @xmath43 can be recovered .    for 2d gapped dirac materials , eq .",
    "( 2 ) is no longer valid due to two reasons : ( i ) the dimensionality is reduced to 2d ; and ( ii ) the energy dispersion follows a relativistic dispersion similar to that of the massive dirac fermions . in the following",
    ", we shall formulate the drift - equation for dirac semiconductor based on bte approach and demonstrate that the sclc mediated by relativistic quasiparticles follows a completely different current - voltage scaling relation .      for massive dirac fermions ,",
    "the energy dispersion is @xmath44 where @xmath45 is the fermi velocity , @xmath46 is the crystal momentum and @xmath47 is the bandgap .",
    "the group velocity is @xmath48 .",
    "the density of states @xmath49 , is rewritten as @xmath50 where @xmath51 denotes the spin - valley degeneracy and @xmath52 is a heaviside function . the electron density at low temperature",
    "can then be obtained from the two - dimensional ( 2d ) density of states @xmath53 which gives @xmath54 and @xmath55 is the fermi level .",
    "the general expression of the 2d linear current density is @xmath56 where @xmath37 is the fermi - dirac distribution function , @xmath38 is the scattering time and @xmath31 is the externally applied electric field . in the low temperature limit ,",
    "the current density can be analytically solved to give @xmath57 .",
    "eliminating @xmath55 via @xmath30 , we obtain @xmath58 where @xmath59 is a bandgap - dependent _ characteristic charge density _ , @xmath30 and @xmath31 are re - expressed as functions of the transport direction , @xmath60 .",
    "the term @xmath61 in eq .",
    "( [ ce ] ) represents a major difference between the relativistic massive dirac fermions and that of the non - relativistic quasi - free electrons . as @xmath62",
    ", it can be seen from the @xmath63-@xmath46 relation that the electrons are non - relativistic at very large @xmath64 or @xmath65 . for",
    "vanishingly small @xmath64 or @xmath66 , the electrons approach ultra - relativsitic limit and become _ massless _ dirac fermions .    by expressing eq .",
    "( 1 ) in the drude form of @xmath67 , a density - dependent _ dirac mobility _ is defined as @xmath68 where @xmath69 .",
    "consequently , the relativistic sclc of massive dirac fermions belongs to the class of _ density - dependent mobility _ sclc .",
    "however , @xmath68 is unique to the massive dirac fermions .",
    "we assume that the sclc is carried solely by electrons injected through an ohmic contact . for simplicity ,",
    "we employ the 1d poisson equation @xmath70 where @xmath71 , @xmath72 is the electrostatic potential , and @xmath73 is the effective dielectric constant . here , we first assume that the 3d carrier density , @xmath74 , is related to @xmath42 via @xmath75 with @xmath76 as an effective thickness ( see modification later ) . by coupling eq .",
    "( [ ce ] ) with the poisson equation via @xmath42 , we obtain the governing equation of the relativistic sclc for dirac solid : @xmath77 we first investigate the solutions of the 1d relativistic sclc , i.e. eq .",
    "( [ sclc ] ) , in two asymptotic limits : ( i ) non - relativistic sclc regime ( @xmath78 ) ; and ( ii ) ultra - relativistic sclc regime ( @xmath79 ) , which allows eq .",
    "( [ ce ] ) to be approximated , respectively , as    [ lim ] @xmath80    the mg scaling is readily recovered from the non - relativistic charge dynamics at large @xmath64 . as the electrons reside just slightly above the bandgap where the inequality @xmath81 holds true , we have @xmath82 where @xmath83 .",
    "it can be shown @xcite that the corresponding current density is in the non - relativistic drude form , which recovers the mg scaling of @xmath84 .    in the opposite limit of @xmath85",
    ", @xmath86 implies ultra - relativistic dynamics with a scaling of @xmath87 as shown in eq .",
    "coincidentally , this has the same scaling to the cl law @xcite although the underlying physics is fundamentally different",
    ". for dirac materials studied there , the ultra - relativistic sclc is obtained from @xmath88 while sclc in vacuum ( or cl law ) is obtained from @xmath89 a simple dimensional analysis @xcite immediately shows that @xmath90 and @xmath91 are both proportional to @xmath92 albeit their very different origins .",
    "nonetheless , eq . ( [ dense ] ) originates from the @xmath93 dependence owing to the _ ultra - relativistic _ electron dynamics in dirac solids while eq .",
    "( [ cl ] ) originates from the @xmath94 dependence owing to the energy balance of a _ non - relativistic _ free electron accelerating in vacuum .",
    "this demonstrates the fundamentally different mechanism behind the @xmath95 scaling in the two cases .",
    "the two limits : @xmath96 and @xmath22 are , respectively , the extreme limits of the ultra - relativsitic and non - relativistic sclc , an intermediate regime of @xmath97 is expected in the case of massive dirac fermions .",
    "this is in good agreement with the experimental observations of @xmath98 in monolayer mos@xmath7 @xcite and @xmath99 in monolayer hbn @xcite where the charge carriers are essentially massive dirac fermions .",
    "the model proposed here suggests that the @xmath23 scaling is @xmath100 to the relativistic carriers without the unjustified or invalid assumption of introducing traps with @xmath21 , which is also inconsistent with the original formulation of the mh law and other trap - limited sclc models as discussed above .     as a function of @xmath101 .",

    "interestingly , the @xmath158-@xmath159 characteristic [ suggested in eq . ( 10 ) ] provides a convenient tool to represent the sclc data that can be generally applied to any solids . to illustrate this point",
    ", we consider a trap - free solid in which the conduction transits from ohmic to sclc at increasing @xmath2 as showin in fig . 3a . in the ohmic regime ( large @xmath159 or small @xmath2 )",
    "where @xmath170 , we have @xmath171 , i.e. @xmath158 decreases with increasing @xmath159 ( green dash - dotted line in fig .",
    "in contrast , in the sclc regime ( small @xmath159 or large @xmath2 ) where @xmath172 , we have @xmath173 , i.e. @xmath158 increases linearly with @xmath159 ( blue dashed line in fig 3a ) .",
    "these contrasting behaviors lead to a @xmath174 peak @xcite in the intermediate regime that clearly separates the sclc - dominated and ohmic - dominated conduction as shown in fig .",
    "this finding is confirmed by using various experimental data ( color symbols ) for mos@xmath7 from ref .",

    "the relativistic sclc model derived above is based on solving the 1d poisson equation . as dirac semiconductor",
    "is a 2d thin film , thus a 2d thin - form model is required . in this section ,",
    "we provide a simplified formalism of 2d thin - film relativistic sclc model without the need to explicitly solve for the 2d model @xcite .",
    "the sclc has been previously formulated for thin - film and nanowire using an integral form of 2d electrostatic poisson equation @xcite . here",
    ", we shall formulate a thin - film sclc relativistic model under the assumption of carrier density - dependent mobility to illustrate that the general sclc scaling properties for dirac semiconductor , which has a density - dependent mobility of @xmath182 .",
    "we consider the @xmath181-dimension transport in a solid with density - dependent mobility in a general form of @xmath183 / f_0 $ ] where @xmath184 $ ] is a density - dependent term and @xmath37 is a constant factor .",
    "the dimensionality of @xmath185 and @xmath186 corresponds to bulk and 2d thin film , respectively . in the following analysis",
    ", we consider the case of _ uniform sclc injection _ where the two electrodes are separated by a fixed spacing of @xmath1 as shown in fig .",
    "for uniform sclc injection along the @xmath60-direction , the electric field profiles , i.e. @xmath187 for bulk ( @xmath185 ) and thin film ( @xmath186 ) can be written , respectively , as    @xmath188    where @xmath189 and @xmath190 denote the surface and volume carrier density respectively . @xmath191 and @xmath192 is , respectively , the 1d and 2d green s function that are dependent on the geometry of contacts .",
    "figures 4(b ) and ( c ) shows a 2d thin film with two possible contact geometries , i.e. edge and strip contacts , respectively@xcite . by eliminating the @xmath193-integration via @xmath194 and suppressing the argument of @xmath195 in eq .",
    "( 12b ) for simplicity , eq .",
    "( 12 ) can be written compactly as @xmath196 where we have introduced dimensionless variable as @xmath197 , and the subscript of @xmath198 denotes surface and bulk carrier density , respectively .",
    "consider the charge transport mechanism in dirac solid belongs to the class of density - dependent mobility model , we assume a general current density of @xmath199}{f_0 } e_{d}(\\xi),\\ ] ] where the subscript @xmath200 denotes linear and areal current density respectively .",
    "the density - dependent mobility is given as @xmath201 \\equiv \\mu_0f[n_\\nu(\\xi)]/f_0 $ ] where @xmath202 $ ] is a @xmath203-dependent term and @xmath37 is a normalization constant . from eq .",
    "( 14 ) , the bias voltage relation : @xmath204 is written as @xmath205 } = e\\mu_0\\frac{v}{l}.\\ ] ] the solution of eq .",
    "( 15 ) gives the equation of sclc .",
    "its full solution require the knowledge of @xmath203 over the intervals from @xmath206 to @xmath207 , which can be obtained by solving the nonlinear integral equation in eq .",
    "nonetheless , the scaling relations , i.e. @xmath208-@xmath2 and @xmath208-@xmath1 , can be readily deduced via a simple _ dimensional analysis _",
    "@xcite without explicitly solving eqs .",
    "( 13 ) and ( 15 ) .",
    "contact geometry for uniform sclc injection .",
    "current is uniformly injected along the @xmath60-direction . for @xmath185 bulk geometry , the constant-@xmath1 geometry is invariant along both @xmath209-and @xmath175-directions whereas for @xmath186 thin - film geometry , the structure is only invariant along the @xmath209-direction .",

    "we now rewrite eqs .",

    "( 18a ) shows that after the integral @xmath223 is fully converted into a dimensionless form , the @xmath208-@xmath2 and @xmath208-@xmath1 scaling relations can be unambiguously determined . in this case",
    ", @xmath223 becomes a _",
    "dimensionless numeric factor _ that does not play any roles in the @xmath208-@xmath2 and @xmath208-@xmath1 scaling relations .    the non - dimensionalization of eq .",
    "( 18a ) can be accomplished by appropriately regrouping the constant term in eq .",
    "( 18b ) , i.e. @xmath224 into each of the @xmath225 and @xmath226 terms in the right - hand side of eq .",
    "( 18b ) such that dimensionless terms @xmath227 and @xmath228 can be defined , respectively , for @xmath203 and @xmath226 .",
    "in general , the regrouping of @xmath229 can be expressed in an arbitrary form of @xmath230 where @xmath231 and @xmath232 are terms containing @xmath208 and @xmath233 and @xmath234 are terms containing @xmath235 . the roles of @xmath236 s and @xmath237 s are to pair up with @xmath238 and @xmath226 in eq .",
    "( 18b ) such that the resulting terms are dimensionless .    in the following ,",
    "we suppress the argument of @xmath236 s and @xmath237 s for simplicity . as the explicit form of @xmath226 determines the regrouping of @xmath229 , @xmath236 s and @xmath237 s",
    "are both @xmath226-dependent . furthermore ,",
    "@xmath236 s are @xmath181-independent and @xmath237 s are @xmath181-dependent as @xmath235 is deliberately distributed only into @xmath237 s .",
    "we can now recast eq .",
    "( 18b ) as @xmath239 where all terms are dimensionless via the following grouping @xmath240 with @xmath227 and @xmath241 now being dimensionless , eq .",
    "( 18a ) can be rewritten as : @xmath242 or more compactly as @xmath243 where @xmath244 is a dimensionless numeric factor dependent on the @xmath181 and @xmath245 , i.e. @xmath246 which can be explicitly solved from eq .",
    "( 18b ) and it affects only the overall magnitude of sclc without affecting its voltage and length scaling relations .",
    "thus the @xmath208-@xmath2 and @xmath208-@xmath1 scaling relations are determined by @xmath247      equation ( 25 ) represents a _",
    "universal sclc scaling relations _ for uniform sclc injection into either a @xmath185 ( bulk ) or @xmath186 ( thin film ) based solid of length @xmath1 with arbitrary density - dependent mobility @xmath201 $ ] .",
    "several remarkable properties can be extracted from eq .",
    "( 25 ) : ( i ) the @xmath208-@xmath2 scaling , i.e. @xmath248 , is determined solely by the @xmath201 $ ] and is _ completely independent on the device geometry ( @xmath245 ) and dimensionality ( @xmath181 ) _ ; ( ii ) the @xmath208-@xmath1 scaling , on the other hand , is affected by both @xmath226 and @xmath181 ; ( iii ) for a fixed @xmath181 (= 1 for bulk or = 2 for thin film ) , the geometry of contacts affects only @xmath244 and hence both scl @xmath208-@xmath2 and @xmath208-@xmath1 scaling are universal independent on contact .    from eq .",
    "( 19 ) , we see the constant term carriers a length scale dependence of @xmath235 , and thus eq .",
    "( 19 ) will be independent of @xmath1 for @xmath186 ( for a thin film setting ) resulting in @xmath249 . in this 2d thin film limit ,",
    "( 23 ) gives the sclc relation for a thin film : @xmath250 note that eq .",
    "( 26 ) includes that both @xmath251-@xmath2 and @xmath251-@xmath1 follow the same scaling relation .",
    "togther with property ( i ) and eq .",
    "( 26 ) , it shows a powerful tool that can be used to directly map the scaling relation of a simple bulk sclc model into 2d thin - film sclc model . by virtual of property ( i ) ,",
    "we conclude that the voltage scaling for thin - film ( @xmath251-@xmath2 ) is identical to the bulk @xmath24-@xmath2 scaling , thus the voltage scaling obtained in sec .",
    "ii are valid for thin film as well . for a thin film , eq .",
    "( 26 ) also dictates that the length ( @xmath251-@xmath1 ) scaling relation is identical to the @xmath251-@xmath2 .    to summarize this session",
    ", we provide a rigorous derivation of scaling laws ( both voltage and length ) for uniform scl injection into a 2d thin film seeting .",
    "these properties allow the @xmath251-@xmath2 and @xmath251-@xmath1 scaling relations of a 2d thin - film to be fully determined from a simple 1d bulk sclc model that have been shown in sec .",
    "the full @xmath251-@xmath2 and @xmath251-@xmath1 scaling relations are thus obtained without the need of explicitly solving the complicated coupled equations in eq ( 18 ) . in appendix a , two examples of 2d thin - film sclc are analyzed using our simplified formalism developed here .",
    "the relativistic sclc scaling relation of dirac semiconductor in 2d thin - film geometry can be readily determined by using the simple derivation developed above . since the 1d sclc scaling relations takes the form of @xmath252 and @xmath253 respectively for the ultra - relativistic and non - relativistic regimes , for 2d thin film , our simple analysis yields @xmath254 where @xmath3 = 2 and @xmath3 = 3/2 are for the non - relativistic and ultra - relativistic limit , respectively . in the intermediate regime",
    ", the scaling follows an approximate power - law form with @xmath3 varies continuously from @xmath255 akin to fig .",
    "2d thin film of dirac semiconductor .",

    ", the small-@xmath260 and large-@xmath260 regime corresponds to @xmath261 ( non - relativistic ) and @xmath262 ( ultra - relativistic ) , respectively .",
    "note that the data points exhibits oscillations at small @xmath260 due to numerical error . ]    to verify eq .",
    "( 27 ) , the relativistic sclc in 2d thin - film geometry with inclusion of exponential traps is explicitly solved ( the full derivation is presented in appendix b ) . in the presence of exponential traps ,",
    "the relativistic sclc in a 2d thin - film dirac semiconductor is    [ 2d ] @xmath263    where @xmath264 , @xmath265 is the 2d carrier density , @xmath266 , @xmath267 with @xmath268 as the effective density of states at the conduction band - edge and @xmath269 as the trap density , @xmath270 and @xmath271 are dimensionless variables . in the ultra - relativistic and non - relativistic sclc regimes ,",

    ", we obtain @xmath275 ( non - relativistic ) and @xmath262 ( ultra - relativistic ) , thus confirming the simple derivation in eq .",
    "this agreement demonstrates that the unconventional @xmath208-@xmath2 scaling of @xmath6 is a universal signature of the relativistic charge carrier dynamics in both bulk and 2d thin - film geometries .    in comparison to prior works in ref .",
    "@xcite , the variation of @xmath276 to @xmath277 with decreasing temperature was attributed to the transition from @xmath278 ( valid ) to @xmath279 ( invalid ) .",
    "our relativistic sclc model with exponential traps presented here is however ever to take account for such temperature dependence without imposing the invalid @xmath21 condition .    to further confirm that the analytical relativistic slcc scaling relation obtained above , the integral equation in eq .",

    "5 show good agreement with the derived scaling laws : @xmath256 ( dotted lines ) at small voltage of @xmath283 and @xmath257 at large voltage of of @xmath284 .",
    "thus , the comparison confirms the two corresponding analytical scaling laws [ see eq .",
    "( 27 ) ] for space charge limited conduction in a 2d thin - film dirac solid with finite bangap : @xmath261 and @xmath262 respectively for the non - relativistic and ultra - relativistic limits .",
    "more importantly , the unconventional relativistic sclc scaling of @xmath97 is unambiguously confirmed for the 2d thin - film dirac semiconductor and is in agreement with experiments @xcite .    finally , we discuss the screening effect on the relativistic sclc in 2d dirac materials . in 2d dirac materials ,",
    "the charge transport is sensitively influenced by the substrate screening and excess charge screening induced by gate - electrode in field - effect - transistor geometry . despite these screening effects , sclc was unambiguously observed in experiments as reported in refs . [ 31 ] and [ 32 ] .",
    "these experimental observations suggest that the screening effect can not entirely remove sclc in 2d materials . in a previous theoretical work @xcite",
    ", it is demonstrated that the surrounding dielectric screening will affect the transport properties of 2d thin film by modifying the relaxation time @xmath38 and a significant mobility enhancement can be achieved via high- dielectric substrate with vanishingly thin membrane . this theoretical prediction was experimentally confirmed in monolayer mos2 with high- substrate@xcite . in relevance to our sclc model , we point out that as the substrate screening effect alters only the relaxation time @xmath38 which comes into the sclc picture as a proportionality constant , it can be reasonably expected that only the magnitude of the sclc will be altered while the new scaling laws reported here will remain unchanged . a microscopic theory of substrate screening can be formulated via first - principle calculation that takes into account the complex many - body interactions at the interface between 2d materials and the substrate@xcite .",
    "the complete microscopic quantum picture od dielectric screening is beyond the scope of this work .",
    "in summary , we have proposed a theory of relativistic space charge limited conduction ( sclc ) in dirac solids with new scaling laws for both bulk and thin file model .",
    "for the one - dimensional ( 1d ) bulk model , the scaling laws are @xmath285 with @xmath97 and @xmath286 . for 2d thin film model",
    ", we have @xmath287 for uniform sclc injection with @xmath3 remaining the same as the case of 1d bulk model under the assumption of density dependent mobility .",
    "both scaling laws have been verified with numerical calculations and have good agreements with experimental results .",
    "the important finding from this paper is the new voltage scaling of @xmath23 which is a signature of the massive dirac fermions in the 2d dirac materials , and can not be explained by using the traditional sclc models derived decades ago for traditional materials .",
    "the inconsistencies in using such traditional sclc models with unjustified traps condition to fit the experimental measurement is questionable .",
    "our results represent a new class of relativistic space - charge phenomena in dirac solids , which may be used to model dirac - based devices operating in space - charge - limited regime and may also be used as a tool to extract useful parameters by fitting the analytical equations with measurements",
    ". the relativistic sclc model should generate unconventional scl photocurrent response @xcite in relativistic dirac semiconductor such as mos@xmath7 .",
    "the widely - studied photoresponse of mos@xmath7 @xcite can be readily used as an additional platform to verify the proposed relativistic sclc model here .",
    "we thank subhamoy ghatak for providing us the experimental data of mos@xmath7 and insightful discussions .",
    "we thank chun yun kee , kelvin j. a. ooi and shi - jun liang for helpful discussions .",
    "this work is supported by singapore ministry of education t2 grant ( t2moe1401 ) and usa afoar aoard grant ( fa2386 - 14 - 1 - 4020 ) .",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> a theory of relativistic space - charge - limited current ( sclc ) is formulated to determine the sclc scaling , @xmath0 , for a finite bandgap dirac material of length @xmath1 biased under a voltage @xmath2 . in a one - dimensional ( 1d ) bulk geometry , </S>",
    "<S> our model allows ( @xmath3 , @xmath4 ) to vary from ( 2,3 ) for the non - relativistic model in traditional solids to ( 3/2,2 ) for the ultra - relativistic model of massless dirac fermions . for a two - dimensional ( 2d ) thin - film geometry , we obtain @xmath5 that varies between 2 and 3/2 , respectively , at the non - relativistic and ultra - relativistic limits . </S>",
    "<S> we further provide a rigorous proof based on a green s function approach that for uniform sclc model described by carrier density - dependent mobility , the scaling relations of the 1d bulk model can be directly mapped into the case of 2d thin film for any contact geometries . </S>",
    "<S> our simplified approach provides a convenient tool to obtain the 2d thin - film sclc scaling relations without the need of explicitly solving the complicated 2d problems . </S>",
    "<S> finally , this work clarifies the inconsistency in using the traditional sclc models to explain the experimental measurement of 2d dirac semiconductor . </S>",
    "<S> we conclude that the voltage - scaling @xmath6 is a distinct signature of massive dirac fermions in dirac semiconductor and is in agreement with experimental sclc measurement in mos@xmath7 . </S>"
  ]
}
